hasData_fileLabel_file: VACCELERATE SHOWCASE EVENT JANUARY 23 2025_ Project Highlights, Key Results & Research Impact.mp4
abstractText_pmd: ['VACCELERATE is a European network dedicated to accelerating clinical trials for vaccines and beyond. As the project draws to a close, we are pleased to invite you to the VACCELERATE Showcase Event, the final webinar of the initiative. Hosted by the project coordinator, Prof. Dr. Oliver A. Cornely, this event will celebrate the successful conclusion of our journey and present a comprehensive overview of the key milestones, highlights, and results achieved throughout the project.']

abstractText_pmd: ["Welcome to the video series of the Global Guideline for the Diagnosis and Management of Candidiasis. Each chapter has been carefully explained by the authors themselves, providing expert knowledge in an accessible format. This video presents the latest insights into Mucocutaneous Infections. Follow this playlist to stay up to date with current trends, risk factors, and global perspectives on candidiasis. Whether you're a healthcare professional, researcher, or student, these videos will help you deepen your understanding of this important topic. Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and turn on notifications to stay informed about new episodes! Publication Link: https://www.thelancet.com/journals/laninf/article/PIIS1473-3099(24)00749-7/fulltext"]

hasData_fileLabel_file: Antifungal Prophylaxis and Stewardship in HSCT.mp4
abstractText_pmd: ['Invasive fungal infections remain a major cause of morbidity and mortality in patients with hematological malignancies, particularly those undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation. Antifungal stewardship programs are crucial for optimizing AF use, reducing resistance, and controlling costs. This webinar presented findings from an international survey on AF prescription patterns and stewardship practices in hematology and transplantation units.Date: 12 May 2025, 13.00-14.00 CEST']

hasData_fileLabel_file: VACCELERATE WEBINAR Data Interoperability in COVID-19 Vaccine Trials.mp4
abstractText_pmd: ['We are excited to invite you to watch this informative webinar on Data Interoperability in COVID-19 Vaccine Trials, where we will delve into the groundbreaking work of the VACCELERATE project. The session covers a crucial aspect of clinical trials: the importance of data standards in ensuring efficient data processing and interoperability across systems. In this webinar, our expert speakers – Zoi D. Pana, Sergio Contrino and Salma Malik – present their insights on how data standards and interoperability play a pivotal role in the development and analysis of COVID-19 vaccine trials. By structuring clinical trial data according to international standards, they have been able to streamline the data analysis process, reduce data cleaning efforts, and facilitate data sharing. The core focus of this presentation is the study’s objective of identifying commonalities and differences in clinical trial metadata, protocols, and data collection systems within the VACCELERATE project. Lessons learned from the VACCELERATE project on data management, protocol design, and the significance of a unified data infrastructure.']
creator_pmd: [{'prefLabel': 'Pana, Zoi-Dorothea', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/1357574983'}, {'prefLabel': 'Pana, Zoi-Dorothea', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/1357574983'}, {'prefLabel': 'Kuster, Alexandra', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/1366157222'}, {'prefLabel': 'Contrino, Sergio', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/1366149939'}, {'prefLabel': 'Contrino, Sergio', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/1366149939'}, {'prefLabel': 'Malik, Salma', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/1366155548'}, {'prefLabel': 'Malik, Salma', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/1366155548'}, {'prefLabel': 'Cornely, Oliver Andreas', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/121712915'}, {'prefLabel': 'CECAD Cluster of Excellence', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/1170078915'}, {'prefLabel': 'Universitätsklinikum Köln', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/10044629-2'}, {'prefLabel': 'VACCELERATE (Projekt)', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/1249149967'}]

hasData_fileLabel_file: VACCELERATE WEBINAR May 22 2024_ Willingness of medical students to participate in trials.mp4
abstractText_pmd: ['Willingness of EU medical and paramedical students to participate in vaccine trials: A cross-sectional VACCELERATE study. With Assistant Prof. Andreas Yiallouris and Lecturer Charis Filippou, as members of the VACCELERATE WP10 team, Medical School of the European University Cyprus, Nicosia, Cyprus. As the world raced to develop, test, and distribute vaccines against SARS-CoV-2, the engagement  of the public and specifically of healthcare workers (HCWs) in vaccine research became a focal point of interest. Understanding the current willingness of medical and paramedical students as future HCWs to participate in vaccine trials across Europe is an essential information for future planning of the EU vaccine research preparedness framework, and for executing successful multinational vaccine development programs in Europe and beyond. In this study, the VACCELERATE network presents the findings from a comprehensive student’s survey aiming at uncovering the reported factors influencing the participation of future HCWs in  vaccine trials. The study surveyed 1,410 subjects, primarily composed of students in various stages  of medical and paramedical training across 11 European countries, offering a broad perspective on the readiness of this volunteer group to engage in future vaccine research. In this webinar, Prof. Yiallouris and Dr. Filippou will describe the findings of the VACCELERATE survey, providing valuable insights into the motivations and barriers that medical and paramedical students across Europe face regarding vaccine trial participation. This offers a foundational perspective for shaping educational programs and public health initiatives to enhance future vaccine trial enrollment and vaccine confidence.']

hasData_fileLabel_file: 2025 Bodey Lecture_ Hematological Cancer and Infectious Disease.mp4
abstractText_pmd: ['In this video, we share the 2025 Bodey Lecture, delivered by Professor Oliver A. Cornely. Professor Cornely received the prestigious Dr. Gerald P. Bodey, Sr., Memorial Distinguished Visiting Professorship Award, granted by the MD Anderson Cancer Center, honoring exceptional contributions to infectious diseases research and education. His lecture, "Hematological cancer and infectious disease – Navigating our patients between Scylla and Charybdis", highlights the current challenges in treating immunocompromised patients, the importance of targeted anti-infective strategies, and innovations in drug development. We extend our sincere thanks to the MD Anderson Cancer Center for kindly providing this video recording.']

abstractText_pmd: ['This episode is part of “MedFacts with Prof. Schmitt”, a video series that brings you clear, science-based information on vaccines. The content is based on the Vaccitutor Course (https://vaccitutor.com/) and presents key vaccine topics in short, easy-to-understand formats. Join Prof. Joe Schmitt as he explains how vaccines work, their development, and their role in public health – all in a concise and engaging way.']

hasData_fileLabel_file: Management of Invasive Mould Disease - Keynote Lecture.mp4
abstractText_pmd: ['Join Prof. Dr. Oliver A. Cornely at the 4th Sun Yat-sen University Pharmacy Conference (16 August 2025) for an in-depth keynote on invasive mould infections. This lecture covers current diagnostic approaches, treatment strategies, and emerging therapies, highlighting challenges and best practices in managing these serious fungal diseases.  Ideal for clinicians, pharmacists, and researchers interested in medical mycology and infectious disease management.']
creator_pmd: [{'prefLabel': 'Cornely, Oliver Andreas', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/121712915'}, {'prefLabel': 'Cornely, Oliver Andreas', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/121712915'}, {'prefLabel': 'Universitätsklinikum Köln. Klinik I für Innere Medizin', '@id': 'https://d-nb.info/gnd/10018507-1'}]

abstractText_pmd: ["With: Francesco Marchesi (IRCCS Istituto Nazionale Tumori Regina Elena, Rome, Italy): Influenza, Jon Salmanton-García (University Hospital Cologne, Germany): RSV, Monika Biernat (Wroclaw Medical University, Wroclaw, Poland): hMPV and Barbora Weinbergerova (Faculty of Medicine Masaryk University, Brno, Czechia): Other respiratory viruses. Hosting and Moderation: Livio Pagano (Catholic University of Sacred Heart, Rome, Italy) and Oliver A. Cornely (University Hospital Cologne, Germany). Viral infections, particularly those affecting the respiratory system, have been underestimated by hematologists for years, partly because methodical diagnostic workups were not performed and because truly effective therapeutic tools for prevention or treatment were lacking. With the COVID-19 pandemic, viral respiratory infections have received increased attention, both for differential diagnosis and for the now available possibility of preventing and treating these types of conditions. The EPIRESEHA registry has made a significant effort over the past years, collaborating with over 150 centers, attempting to collect information first on COVID-19 alone, which until two years ago was the main emergency, and in recent years on all other respiratory viral infections (i.e., influenza, RSV, etc.). The registry's goal is to gather as much epidemiological information as possible on these types of complications in order to better identify patients most at risk for early intervention. The webinar we propose includes young but highly qualified speakers who have developed expertise on these issues over the years and will share it in their presentations. The ultimate goal is to raise awareness of viral respiratory infections by improving knowledge and encouraging everyone to participate in the collection of case studies that can only increase our knowledge."]
